content.description:
Social psychologists conducted a series of studies on the amount of time it takes for a person to offer help to someone in distress. Two research conditions were created. In one condition, the helper was alone. In the other condition, the helper was in a group with 4 other people. The study results are summarized in the table.

Time in Seconds to Intervene

Helper Alone

Helper in Group

20

100

15

80

30

60

15

60

10

50
content.question: According to the table, what was the range in the time it took for a person in a group to offer help to someone in distress?

skill.text: 3.B: Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency, variation, and percentile rank in a given data set.
